Breastfeeding practices at six months postpartum:  Pooled results from three RCTs (1,3,6) 
showed a borderline increase in the risk of stopping breastfeeding by 6 months of age in 
the group of mothers and newborns discharged within 48 hours of birth (RR=1.06, 95% 
CI 0.95 to 1.18). There was significant heterogeneity between the studies (I 2=81.1%). The 
overall quality of evidence was graded as very low. 
In conclusion, this systematic review showed very low to low quality eviden
